DOI: 10.1109/MS.2021.3058492 I joined EECS in February 2002, after a few years as Senior Researcher at (Mitel Networks). From 2002 to 2013, I was Associate Rapporteur on Formal languages and telecommunication software at the International Telecommunication Union (ITU-T), where I led the development of the User Requirements Notation (URN) standard. I also lead the development of the jUCMNav tool for URN modeling and analysis. My research interests span many domains, from requirements/software engineering to modelling (goals and business processes), regulatory compliance, healthcare informatics, and smart contracts. I hold a Ph.D. and a M.Sc. from the University of Ottawa (2001 and 1994), as well as a B.Sc. from Laval University (1992), all in Computer Science. I am a member of OIQ (professional engineer) and Senior Member of IEEE. I am on the Editorial Boards of the following journals: Requirements Engineering (REJ), Springer Software and Systems Modeling (SoSyM), Springer I am member of the Steering Committee of the IEEE International Requirements Engineering Conference, and former Chair of the SDL Forum Society. I am also affiliated with the following research organizations: Contract Specification and Monitoring Lab LIFE Research Institute IBM/Telfer Centre for Business Analytics and Performance Institut du savoir Montfort (ISM) Telfer Health Transformation Exchange (THTex) I am involved in the following conferences, so please submit papers and participate! 5th International Conference on Process Mining (ICPM 2023) (programme committee), Rome, Italy, 23-27 October 2023. 15th System Analysis and Modelling (SAM) Conference (program committee), Västerås, Sweden, 2-3 October 2023.
